embeds.title: Terminator
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 (0) :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

**Encode.**
**Compile** - If this is the last card of the Function, it gains 'Play this again'.

messages.content: one of the best cards in Automaton's kit
being able to jam two cards together and play them twice is insanely good
the "two cards" are the other two cards of the function
perfection() is also very funny
https://tenor.com/view/slay-the-spire-downfall-mod-gif-25473691
https://tenor.com/view/slay-the-spire-downfall-mod-gif-25473691
LMAO
https://giant.gfycat.com/AggressiveEvergreenAvocet.mp4
the timing
that was funny from you two
yeah this goes infinite with <sundial> and goto

embeds.title: Sundial
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Slay the Spire

Every 3 times you shuffle your draw pile, gain :colorless_energy: :colorless_energy: .
*"Early man's foolish obsession with time caused them to look to the sky for guidance, hoping for something permanent." - Zoroth*

messages.content: one of two auto cards that makes going infinite a bit too easy
technically this turns a 3-card function into a 4-card function (2 cards twice) but duping some effects is often extremely strong
putting a draw card in there lets the function redraw itself
which is hilarious
Secretly the real perfection is Goto+/Buggy Mess/Terminator

I think a lot of newer Automaton players try to make lots and lots of ok quality functions, when making just a couple super powerful functions is better, and Goto+/Buggy Mess/Terminator is an extreme example of that
*angry Cuboid Consumer noises*
Is Goto the best starter card of any character? I suppose Eruption is also a strong contender
at least you can replace Eruption with a Tantrum if you ever lose Eruption
you cannot replace Goto
EVER
I think Goto is certainly the starter card I have duped most often
And I almost always upgrade it at start of the run
Eh I kinda disagree
Think of it this way. You either play 3 cards for your function, or 2 cards twice (4 total) but now you have to line up when you draw terminator to actually get the value
yes
that said, there are some things that get a lot better when double-played
one example is a function with goto being able to draw itself

Also for the turns where you assemble the functions, you play a total of 6 cards basically. In this situation you play card A, card B, and terminator. That is 2 card effects. Then you double play the function, so you play A and B 2 more times, resulting in 6 total cards played.
In a non-terminator function, you play A, B, C. Then the function plays A, B, and C meaning you in total play 6 cards.
So terminator doesn't even play more cards until you redraw the function.
Which at that point, where you already are in your 2nd deck cycle and have a lot of functions you probably don't need as much support.

so you do AAABBB instead of ABCABC
all I will say is:
it's a lot easier to find two good cards than it is to find three

The time auto is weakest in a fight is the first deck cycle and this doesn't help much with alleviating that, if anything it can make it worse because if you draw it at an inopportune time and can't have it as the last part of a function, you basically only drew 4 cards that turn.
It has the same issue as the form card, it does very little to help you when you need it most.
But the form card scales much harder so it isn't as bad (still not great)
but terminator is a lot cheaper

this card is good but its sort of hard to justify picking a lot of the time. I used to really love taking terminator and constructor in my automation decks back when I was making them with the goal of creating certain kinds of functions every fight; in that context being able to make your function play itself twice could be gamebreaking with cards like goto, block chain and buggy mess. But ever since i've just been playing automation with my brain off with the "random bullshit go" strategy this card has not really been put into a lot of deck.  Just because it has to be played last in your function you can be forced to not play this card which is bad when you just want to mass produce random functions. Its still good when you do want to think though and is super strong with coil and runic pyramid

A very powerful card, but also situational. Has some incredible synergies with goto, buggy mess, sundial, runic pyramid, and electromagnetic coil. If your deck is capable of playing 2-3 encode cards a turn (infinite beams), then it's also much easier to get this snuck in as the last card in a function. However, there is a real risk that this card doesn't do anything at all if you can't get it into the last spot, and outside of return and runic pyramid, automaton doesn't have many tools to help play terminator at the right moment. 

When you compare it with constructor and separator, it's a much higher risk, with a bigger reward. Depending on how much you want to go for some of the really high quality functions or try to go infinite, your mileage will vary. Personally, I really believe in the "make as many random functions as fast as you can" strategy, as stapling nearly any set of 3 cards together and making the result cost just 1 energy (while also having it very likely scale with strength and dex multiple times) is more than powerful enough. I don't think you *need* to chase the high of sick terminator combos, when you can achieve the much more consistent strategy of thinning your deck down to several very efficient cards with much less fuss. I just don't see a need to take on that extra risk, even though the end result can absolutely be impressive.
I think if you take a lot of encode cards (which you should be) the chances of not being able to encode this last is really low
personally my strategy for auto is always just "unga bunga play as many functions as possible", and if you're not carefully drafting the perfect function this card is more trouble than it's worth

to the Goto discussion earlier, I think goto is kinda weird as a starter card because it's the only starter that I can think of which is terrible at the start of the game but becomes stronger later on
for that reason I don't really like it as a card
in act 1 most of the time it just takes up the space in your hand that would have been a strike or defend, then costs 1 energy to draw some more strikes/defends or maybe a common attack.
and unupgraded, "some more" strikes and defends is really "the same slot in your hand that it was taking up"
By the middle of act 1 it is fine
and I'd say float definitely gets a lot better in late game when the free advance is more needed
Good with the goto starter card and decks that duplicate it over multiple functions
It does get a bit redundant however if you get the draw number on the gotos up to like 5

I'm pretty sure the reason goto is a starter card is because it would be way too strong if you could draft multiples if it was a common or uncommon instead. It's a very frequent duplication target (in part because of how little card draw automaton has, as well as how strong getting through your deck quickly and reshuffling is). You could definitely make an argument that neutralize gets much stronger later in the game, just due to the nature of how weak scales with the game (though it is still pretty good early in the run too). Goto starts to be pretty good once you've drafted 4-5 cards into your deck and you're no longer just drawing more strikes and defends
I mean I think goto is just auto's best card at all points in a run usually
Sometimes it falls off but not usually in my decks
Idk auto has a lot of pretty good cards
And functions all in all feel too similar tbh
<cycle>

Keyword / Downfall

Discard a card, drawing a new card to replace it.

messages.content: Whats that card uh

**Cycle** each **Status**, dealing 7 damage for each.
